ygData.subject: Re: Disenchanting
ygData.msgSnippet: My thought was that ADM would prevent weapons from proc ing on your group members when sung.  The song references that I ve found on the net say that ADM
ygData.messageBody:
My thought was that ADM would prevent weapons from proc'ing on your group
members when sung. The song references that I've found on the 'net say that
ADM "cancels magic", etc., but no one has been able to prove that it actually
does such. Since GZ has said that very few of our songs are left unfinished
(and I would expect those to be higher level ones), I was trying to come up
with a reasonable untested use for a song with the title "Disenchanting".

Maybe it un-Charms other group members?

Crier Sharpsong - 21st song bard on Fennin Ro


Jason A. Farqu´┐¢
CDI at http://www.pigging.com/



----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, September 12, 1999 2:44 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Disenchanting


> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Fri, 10 Sep 1999, JasonF wrote:
> >
> > The title of the tune though is "Disenchanting". This implies to me that
it
> > removes magical enchantment from *items*. Since it is unlikely to remove
the
> > MAGIC status of a weapon altogether, perhaps it removes "procs" that a
weapon
> > might have. Has anyone gone into an Arena, run ADM and seen if procing
> > weapons didn't proc on you? Maybe a Staff of Writhing and a PGT against
you
> > and ADM?
>
> That would be very bad since the song only affects your party
> members. :-)
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
